body:
Haven't done one of these in ages, and I want to be more open to the community. Feel free to ask me anything, whether that's a question regarding Avicus and its whereabouts, my duties or a question about off topic shenanigans. I'm reluctant to answer "opinions on me" questions but I will try and remain honest. 

These threads are getting boring to read aren't they?

replies.body:
Legit everyone did! I remember I went to Nandos for lunch, and I ordered burger and chips - which were delicious mind you - and this is how it went:
Me: I'll grab the flavour burger and peri peri chips thanks.
*Staff look at me*
Staff: Ohhh chups OK 
Me: Chips yes, thanks

Was the most interesting encounter I've had overseas...

I don't like ice cream, but if we are talking gelato then green apple is the winner.

replies.body:
You have definitely matured over these recent months, and is able to be quite independent. I appreciate that you take initiative by approaching me if something is concerning you. Another hard working moderator who is trustworthy of handling given tasks. You are also a legend for helping me out with those suggestions. 

I don't see much improvement that needs to be made, but if there is I will hit you up on slack since I believe it's a private matter.
replies.body_tagged:

I don't see much improvement that needs to be made, but if there is I will hit you up on slack since I believe it's a private matter.

replies.body:
Ah Sam, I remember the time we had playing together back in the thriving days, you are fun to hang around with... Even though I haven't done so in ages. 

Avicus is a network, no, a community that will remain with me for a life time. I've had so many good memories that came from this server so of course, I don't want to see it die. I guess that is the main reason why I've return a couple times, so I can be there advancing the server in any way possible. The community is tight knit, which is a vision that Keenan has had for many years. I'm especially thankful to the developers, especially Keenan and Javi for inspiring and motivating me to continue learning code. They have helped me with issues that I have struggled to get past. I could go on for days about Avicus, but I'll save that for an essay.

Favourite meme? Probably Camemes!
replies.body_tagged:

Avicus is a network, no, a community that will remain with me for a life time. I've had so many good memories that came from this server so of course, I don't want to see it die. I guess that is the main reason why I've return a couple times, so I can be there advancing the server in any way possible. The community is tight knit, which is a vision that Keenan has had for many years. I'm especially thankful to the developers, especially Keenan and Javi for inspiring and motivating me to continue learning code. They have helped me with issues that I have struggled to get past. I could go on for days about Avicus, but I'll save that for an essay.

Favourite meme? Probably Camemes!

Well, in Bali we don't seem to notice its Australia Day, so it has been the usual day by day activities. I return on Saturday so maybe I can celebrate then!

replies.body:
I think you are misunderstood so easily, due to how serious and tense you are. You should try and loosen up, because some people (including me) can't differentiate your jokes between your statements :P
That aside, you were a core part of the moderation team. You were never afraid to speak up and be the voice of many. You have very strong opinions which is why I think you clash a lot, and to be honest you shouldn't have retired... Mainly because the conditions and moderating environment is improving rapidly.

Orange / Crimson

Halcyon!

replies.body:
Wonderful, just sold my new and improved "stoned" package. Trippy!

PEL you are a great friend of mine, and have always been. Even though you got a lot of undeserved hate, you always took it on the chin and kept doing what you did best. I hope we one day meet up, we need to chill on team speak again when I am not playing Elsword :P

I see myself doing many things. I plan to continue study on Computer Science whilst majoring in Robotics or something along those lines. Get a job here in Melbourne for couple years, preferably at an international (globalised) business. Eventually I want to move to Japan and work there as a Software Engineer for the robot/technology industry over there.

replies.body:
Another great friend of mine, and we have known each other for a long time. I remember when we did public rushes together, coordinating pushes with random team members and it really enlightened everyone. It is such a shame you did something wrong as your time as junior mod, I was really hoping you could thrive and improve Avicus with your strong opinions. 

I didn't meet meet up with Kylo? I met up with Mango, though. He was down in Melbourne for a Rubix cube tournament, and it just happened to be close by.

replies.body:
Great map developer, but I haven't seen you much otherwise due to timezones. One day we should talk it up on team speak or something since I've heard pretty cool things about you.

Pocky's

I found mczone through a friend of mine who had already played lots of it, and it seemed really fun. 

If the 1.7 support came sooner, it would have been really good. However at the moment there is too many version supports. It'll probably be removed.

Never had an issue with them, and they are nice people!

Not on its own, but if it's combined with other ingredients then it's tasty...

reply_to.body: hey jozz whats up hows it been

replies.body:
You were a hard working moderator, and Inappreciated the fact that if you wanted some help you approached me about it. It's a shame you retired though.

Good!

What I say can be impactful so I don't really want to name them publicly. 

No. I am happy where I am now, and I don't want any added stress to my daily work - especially when I'm entering my final school year. Hopefully I'm just as influencial as a senior than I would be as an admin!

Avicus has been claimed "dead" for over 2 years now, and look... We are still getting by. The outlook seems positive, and we are currently working internally  in ensuring that that positive future is soon, rather than later.
replies.body_tagged:
You were a hard working moderator, and Inappreciated the fact that if you wanted some help you approached me about it. It's a shame you retired though.

Good!

What I say can be impactful so I don't really want to name them publicly. 

No. I am happy where I am now, and I don't want any added stress to my daily work - especially when I'm entering my final school year. Hopefully I'm just as influencial as a senior than I would be as an admin!

Avicus has been claimed "dead" for over 2 years now, and look... We are still getting by. The outlook seems positive, and we are currently working internally  in ensuring that that positive future is soon, rather than later.
